Internal Listening District 3

Paper cuts are weather. We teach you to dress for it.

In the cedar quiet above the old tramline, we host week-long and month-long stays for people who no longer treat small pain as random. Here, your hands become an instrument panel. Here, bark is a language.

Enter the current season

Residencies in Soft Discipline

Each room is white, each corridor is green, each morning begins with the municipal bell and a bowl of pear broth. We do not promise comfort. We promise interpretation.

Three-Night Intake

For first listeners. Includes two bark conferences, one hand-mapping, and supervised envelope opening at dusk.

Ten-Day Civic Silence

No speaking after noon. Signature tracking, orchard walks, and archival sessions in the splinter chamber.

Forty-Day Ministry Cycle

For returning guests preparing to serve as neighborhood interpreters. Includes robe fitting and lantern duty.

Evening Oath

One sentence recited before sleep. It changes how your pulse hears the room.

Clinic Notes

Do I need prior retreat experience?

No. Bring two shirts with loose sleeves and one unopened paper letter. Our intake team will guide you through first contact protocols.

Are injuries expected?

Minor cuts are treated as communicative events, not accidents. Licensed staff clean and dress every mark immediately.

Can I visit for a day?

We offer a monthly public observance from 14:00 to 18:00. Advance registration is required due to chamber capacity.

Where are you located?

North ridge of Valeward Forest, Tram Stop 7, opposite the old conservatory baths.
